refnamediv.refpurpose: Displays a tree view of a list, tlist, mlist, cell or structure array, Xcos block

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: tree_show(x) tree_show(x, rootTitle) tree_show(x, rootTitle, styles) tree_show(x, rootTitle, styles, arrayByFields)

listitem.para: Container to display. Supported containers: list, mlist, tlist, array of cells, array of structures, identifier of an Xcos block. Other containers may be nested in x.
Single string: explicit label of the tree's root, for instance the name of the x variable in the calling environment. Default = "".
listitem.note: HTML.4 styling tags can be used to change the style of the root's title. Example: "The title" will display The title in bold red.

listitem.para: Single string = HTML.4 styling tag, including the "$" character that will be replaced with the address (fields names, lists indices..) of each data.

The styles option can be used to customize the style either of addresses, or of related contents, or both. Examples: "$" : address in bold, content in normal black. "$" : address in normal black, content in italic. "$" : both address and content in italic. "$" : address in grey, content in italic.
Default = "<font color=""blue"">$</font>" (address in blue, content in black).

Single boolean, used only for arrays of structures:
%T : For each field of the struct, the array of its values is displayed.
%F :
For each structure of the array, its fields and their values are displayed.
The chosen display mode is used as well for every nested array of structures, at any depths.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: Creates a window and displays a tree view of the given container.

refsection.title: Examples

td.programlisting: films = struct("Title", "A.I. Artificial Intelligence",.. "Year", 2001, .. "Director", "Steven Spielberg", .. "Duration", 140); L = list([%t %f %f], .. $:-1:3, .. int8([1 2 3 ; 4 5 6]), .. [-%inf, -1, 0, %i, 7.1, 3.3e20, %inf, %nan], .. sparse([0 1 2; 3 0 4]), .. ["This" "is" "some" "text"], .. , .. sin, .. logspace, .. iolib, .. {%pi, "abcd" ; list(,)(1),(%i-%s)^3}, .. {}, .. films); tree_show(L)
